channel.title: History on mostlymaths.net
channel.description: Recent content in History on mostlymaths.net

item.title: 2019#35 Readings of the Week
item.description: A flight last Sunday meant I was so sleepy I skipped sending last week’s newsletter… so this week is super-sized. A lot of content about distributed teams I think.

item.title: 2019#34 Readings of the Week
item.description: This week is somewhat more eclectic than usual. There is nothing about any particular programming language. There is a bit on Kubernetes, functional programming and containers, project management, aviation history, interviews/bios… I have started reading a few more papers, and I’ll share the interesting ones as well. This week they are centered in data engineering.

item.title: 2019#32-33 Readings of the Week
item.description: Yeah, I skipped last week. On Saturday Python Barcelona organised PyDay 2019, and I was one of the organisers aside from giving a workshop on PySpark, so I felt pretty tired on Sunday. Of course this means this is a double issue.

item.title: 2019#26 Readings of the Week
item.description: A bit of Python, some more Rust and the usual randomness. The first one looks tasty.

item.title: 2019#25 Readings of the Week
item.description: Heavy focus on Python’s asyncio this week. Also, one of the best books of the year.

item.title: 2019#23 Readings of the Week
item.description: I have been on quite the hiatus, making this more of a readings of the month edition. Sorry!

item.title: 2019#20,21,22 Readings of the week
item.description:
I have been pretty busy lately, and although reading doesn’t stop, my writing sometimes takes a hiatus.

Data engineering, adtech, history, apple. Expect a similar wide range in the future as well. You can check all my weekly readings by checking the tag here . You can also get these as a weekly newsletter by subscribing here.

item.title: 2019#19 Readings of the week
item.description: History, haskell, Wardley mapping, functional programming. Expect a similar wide range in the future as well. You can check all my weekly readings by checking the tag here. You can also get these as a weekly newsletter by subscribing here.

item.title: 2019#18 Readings of the week
item.description: Software engineering, history, planning, data engineering. Expect a similar wide range in the future as well. You can check all my weekly readings by checking the tag here . You can also get these as a weekly newsletter by subscribing here.

item.title: 2019#17 Readings of the week
item.description:
_This week is a bit light on technical content because I was attending Scala Days 2019 in Lausanne and I had enough with the talks. _

Software engineering, psychology, history. Expect a similar wide range in the future as well. You can check all my weekly readings by checking the tag here . You can also get these as a weekly newsletter by subscribing here.
